intro: Achyronia pallescens, commonly known as the pale achyronia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, pale green stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and yellowish, appearing in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
